intro: Camoensia laurentii, commonly known as the laurentian camomile, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, daisy-like yellow flowers and aromatic leaves. It typically grows in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Camoensia laurentii is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in herbal remedies.
